content.raw:
The plugin currently doesn't have a `Fini` function, but it has a `WorldPtr`, so I'm not sure it will be able to tear down properly due to a reference loop. I think there's two options:

1. Add a `Fini` function that resets the `ConnectionPtr` and `SubscriberPtr` first of all so that there won't be any further callbacks, then calls `node->Fini()`, clears `PublisherPtr`s and the `WorldPtr`. I think that might be enough.

2. Use a weak world pointer, and re-order the private data class so that the `ConnectionPtr` and `SubscriberPtr` are at the bottom of the list so that they are destructed first. I think this will work, but I'm not sure if `node->Fini()` still needs to be called in a `Fini` function
